intro: Phanera comosa, commonly known as the hairy phanera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
